intro: Holopeira lonchophylla, commonly known as the long-leaf holopeira, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
